intro: Pycreus setiformis, commonly known as the slender pycreus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with slender, upright stems. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical in shape, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, are borne in dense inflorescences and attract various pollinators.
